de.fuberlin.panda.metadata.result.fusion.type

Class TypeProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.fuberlin.panda.metadata.result.fusion.type.TypeProperties

  • public class TypeProperties
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for parsing an type.properties file into lists of String values representing the possible formats respectively languages.
    Since:
    06.03.2014
    Author:
    Sebastian Schulz
    See Also:
    init(String), #setFormats(String), #setLanguages(String)

      static void init(java.lang.String filePath)
      This method reads the properties file from the given filePath and calls #parsePropertyList(String)) and parsePropertyTree(String) to convert the properties into the addicted list and to parse the trees.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init()

      • init

        public static void init(java.lang.String filePath)
        This method reads the properties file from the given filePath and calls #parsePropertyList(String)) and parsePropertyTree(String) to convert the properties into the addicted list and to parse the trees.

      • parsePropertyList

        protected static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> parsePropertyList(java.lang.String property)
        This method parses a comma separated list of properties from the given String called property and returns a ArrayList containing all values.
        Parameters:
        property - - a comma separated String representation all possible formats.
        Returns:
        propertyValues - an ArrayList of String objects.

      • parsePropertyTree

        protected static TypeTree parsePropertyTree(java.lang.String property)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        This method parses a tree from a given String called property. Therefore it uses the free to use newick parser published on bitbucket.
        Parameters:
        property - - a String object which has to be in valid Newick Format (check Newick Format Wikipedia).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - - in case something gone wrong while parsing.
